alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 9:40AM EST until January 14 at 4:25AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Hardin and Nelson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered. At 40.0 feet, Water begins to cross low spots on some county roads. Some homes in flood plain are cutoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 38.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 38.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.3 feet on 02/22/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
